channel.title: tidyverse on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in tidyverse on A Hugo website

item.title: Building a Spotify Recommendation Model With R
item.description:
Author: Ed Orlando Problem Statement This tutorial shows you how to create a Spotify Recommendation Algorithm using the recommenderlab() and arules() packages.
Load Libraries To get started, first load the libbraries listed below. # Core & Viz library(tidyverse) library(tidyquant) library(plotly) # Modeling library(recommenderlab) library(arules) #library(arulesViz) Load Data The data was previously downloaded using Exportify. There were 27 various genres included and each genre has 10-60 various playlists included.

item.title: Loading Multiple Files from Various Folders in R
item.description: Author: Ed Orlando Problem Statement This tutorial shows you how to load multiple files from multiple folders using R. As a bonus, this article will also show you how to add the folder and file names to the tibble. Load Libraries Tidyverse and readxl are the only libraries required for this tutorial. library(tidyverse) library(readxl) Data Description In this example, Spotify playlist data was downloaded using Exportify.
